SENT.plain: Pseudotumoral presentation of Neuro-BehÃ§et's disease has been described before
The diagnosis may be difficult obtain in patients without mucosal, cutaneous, and ocular signs
We report the observation of a young patient suffering from a right hemiparesis with computed-tomographic (CT) features suggestive of a thalamocapsular expanding lesion
Histologic study of brain biopsy tissue ruled out a tumor but did not show any specific diagnosis
The patient improved with steroid therapy
